recommendations: Aman Agarwal â€œShubh is a very hard-working and dedicated person. He is always looking forward to maximize his skills and comes up with really innovative ideas and alternatives. His interest in the domain of Machine Learning is a lot appreciated and keeps on finding newer ways to execute his ideas. He is someone who is very focused and keeps working on projects one after the other. He is a great teammate and is always willing to help others. He suggests new directions to explore. He is a person with a vision and inspires his teammates to strive for the same. I admire the way he looks up to success and hope to work and learn a lot more from him. â€

Tisha Chawla â€œI got the opportunity to team up with Shubh in various events .Shubh is a very diligent worker who strives to do every task alloted to him with utmost perfection. Not only does he possess good technical knowledge on Web Development and Machine Learning but also has a very approachable and amiable personality.He has excellent managerial skills and tries to use every opportunity provided to him in a wise manner.â€

publications: [{"title":"A secure and light-weight patient survival prediction in Internet of Medical Things framework","subtitle":"Wiley Online Library","date":"May 31, 2024","description":"This study explores predicting postoperative outcomes in major lung resections for primary lung cancer using a dataset from UCI's Machine Learning Repository. Employing ensemble learning classifiers, it found the extra trees classifier achieved 0.92 accuracy with all features, and 0.91 accuracy with selected subjective and objective data. Key features like PRE5, PRE4, and AGE were identified as significant, highlighting the value of feature selection. The findings provide valuable insights for predictive modelling in thoracic surgeries within the IoMT framework."},{"title":"SYN-GAN: A robust intrusion detection system using GAN-based synthetic data for IoT security","subtitle":"Internet of Things","date":"May 10, 2024","description":"As technological communication advances, diverse datasets are exchanged across IoT environments, which are vulnerable to attacks and data breaches. To combat these risks, researchers are experimenting with network intrusion detection systems (NIDS). However, data imbalance and high collection costs hinder effective machine learning (ML) model training. Our study addresses this by using 100% synthetic data generated via Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN) for training NIDS ML models. This approach reduces dependency on real-world data, achieving high accuracy and performance across the UNSW-NB15, NSL-KDD, and BoT-IoT datasets, and demonstrating the potential of generative data in cybersecurity."},{"title":"MobileNet-GRU fusion for optimizing diagnosis of yellow vein mosaic virus","subtitle":"Ecological Informatics","date":"March 2, 2024","description":"Yellow vein mosaic virus (YVMV) is a destructive plant virus that commonly affects crops, particularly okra, in India. The virus is transmitted by whiteflies and poses significant challenges to agricultural productivity. Infection with YVMV leads to distinct yellow vein patterns on leaves, stunted growth, reduced yield, and ultimately economic losses for farmers. Timely and accurate detection of YVMV is crucial for effective disease management. In this article, we present a novel method that employs advanced deep-learning models to identify YVMV-infected okra plants. The study leverages a dataset of over 2000 okra plant leaves that implements transfer learning models, including MobileNet, EfficientNet, InceptionV3, VGG19, InceptionResNetV2, and ResNet50 and recurrent neural networks (RNN) variants, including Long short-term memory (LSTM), Bidirectional long short-term memory (BiLSTM) and Gated recurrent unit (GRU). Additionally, three hybrid models, combining MobileNet with LSTM, BiLSTM, and GRU, are incorporated to capitalize on the characteristics of both MobileNet and RNNs through superior feature extraction and detection of temporal dependencies. The results demonstrate that the MobileNet model combined with all three RNNs achieves exceptional accuracy, surpassing 99.27%. Notably, the MobileNet model integrated with GRU exhibits the most optimized performance with the least loss and greatest accuracy, facilitating improved disease management strategies and aiding in the yield of crops by reducing the impact of YVMV."},{"title":"A Prognostic Framework for Post-Operative Patient Survival Prediction in IoMT","subtitle":"Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)","date":"February 16, 2024","description":"The study presents an Internet of Medical Things (IoMT) framework designed to predict patient survival outcomes through the evaluation of a post-thoracic surgery scenario. We employ a multi-layered IoMT framework that integrates various sensors and medical devices for real-time data collection, efficient data transmission, and data analysis. Utilizing a set of eight traditional and ensemble machine learning classifiers, along with neural networks optimized using grid search, we establish a baseline performance for the framework's capability in predicting post-surgical survival rates. However, as individual machine learning classifiers exhibit suboptimal performance across the performance metrics used, we combine the individual strengths of these classifiers to construct a stacking approach. The stacked classifier which incorporates a multi-layer perceptron as the final estimator achieved significant results, including a high accuracy of 0.90, precision of 0.87, and recall of 0.93. These metrics not only indicate a high post-operative survival detection rate but also demonstrate a balance of low bias and high variance performance, ensuring that the model is both accurate and reliable in varying IoMT scenarios."},{"title":"Hyperparameter Optimization of Machine Learning Models for Monitoring Menstrual Mental Health","subtitle":"Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)","date":"September 29, 2023","description":"Presented at IEEE inC4, this study uses text-mining to analyze women's sentiments during Premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD) and menstrual cycles. By applying various machine learning techniques, it identifies emotional patterns, highlighting the prevalence of negative emotions."},{"title":"Performance Comparison of Recurrent Neural Networks for Metamorphic Malware","subtitle":"Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)","date":"September 22, 2023","description":"This work was presented at the IEEE ICDSNS conference. Our research introduces a deep learning approach using Bidirectional LSTM (BiLSTM) to detect metamorphic malware, addressing challenges of dataset availability and evolving threats. This approach enhances malware detection and holds potential for broader cyber threat applications."},{"title":"IncepForest: A Novel Approach for Sign Language Recognition with Transfer and Ensemble Learning","subtitle":"Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)","date":"August 9, 2023","description":"I showcased a paper at the IEEE APSIT Conference, focusing on emerging human-computer interface advancements igniting enthusiasm for hand gesture detection due to its versatility. Our innovation, IncepForest, cleverly merges InceptionResNetV2 and Random Forest, yielding an exceptional hybrid model. Notably, our paper secured the coveted Best Paper Award at the event."},{"title":"A Multipronged Approach for Modeling Menopausal Health Using Ensemble Learning","subtitle":"Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)","date":"July 25, 2023","description":"My team and I presented this paper at the 58th ICEST Conference held in Serbia, exploring the effectiveness of ensemble learning for sentiment analysis of menopausal experiences on Twitter. Our research holds significance in providing profound insights into women's emotional journeys during menopause."}]
projects: [{"title":"Crop Booster","start_date":"Jun 2022","end_date":"Jul 2022"},{"title":"The Raddiwala","start_date":"Jun 2021","end_date":"Jul 2021","description":"A website to help scrap dealers get notified about the time and location of the registered user to take the scraps."},{"title":"Smart Grid and Green Energy Systems (SGGESâ€™21)","start_date":"May 2021","end_date":"Jul 2021","description":"Developer of the website for the Virtual International Conference on Smart Grid and Green Energy Systems (SGGESâ€™21). The conference is a platform for researchers, academicians as well as professionals from all over the world to present, discuss and promote advances in research and practice in the field of smart grid and renewable energy systems."},{"title":"RAG App for Interpreting SEC-EDGAR Findings","description":"This repository contains a Retrieval-Augmented Generation application designed to efficiently interpret SEC-EDGAR of 3 tickers. It extracts, processes, and analyzes financial documents using Large Language Models [Gemini-pro] to provide actionable financial insights."}]
